raw_response: Marmuma is a **slow-cooked Tunisian Jewish vegetable dish with a concentrated, jam-like consistency** that is thick and deeply stewed rather than soupy or stew-like. It visually appears as a richly red tomato and pepper confit that is dense, almost paste-like due to hours of slow cooking which caramelizes and melds the vegetables together into a thick, spreadable texture. It does not contain chunks of large protein pieces, as it is naturally vegan and focused on stewed vegetables (mostly tomato
